sentences.english: Most of the crime is petty theft such as pick pocketing and purse snatching.
sentences.chinese: 大多數的犯罪都是小竊盜案件，如扒竊或偷竊錢包。

sentences.english: He got the sack for petty thieving.
sentences.chinese: 他因微小竊盜遭到了解僱。

sentences.english: How did the thieves learn the combination used to open the safe ?
sentences.chinese: 竊盜們如何曉得用以開保險櫃的暗碼？

sentences.english: There were two break-ins at restaurants during last week.
sentences.chinese: 上週餐館發生兩次竊盜。

sentences.english: Looting , robbing, smuggling and plundering are the hobbies of every healthy pirate.
sentences.chinese: 掠奪，搶劫，走私和竊盜是每個健康的海盜的嗜好。

sentences.english: Most thefts occur on the first two floors.
sentences.chinese: 大多數的竊盜在最初二樓上發生。

sentences.english: There were numerous reports of theft in our city.
sentences.chinese: 這城市有多件的竊盜案。

sentences.english: He was proved guilty of steal.
White day, doing nothing, just like made a larceny.
sentences.chinese: 白白的過一天，無所事事，就像犯了竊盜罪一樣。

definition: to track down and seize (a criminal suspect, contraband etc)
to search for and seize (criminals, smuggled goods etc)
(of police etc) to stop (sb) for inspection/to pull (sb) over
to order the arrest of sb as criminal/to list as wanted
to bring to justice/to punish according to the law
